title: An appeals court says 'undated' Pennsylvania ballots don't count
description: A federal appeals panel says mailed ballots arriving on time but in envelopes without dates handwritten by Pennsylvania voters shouldn't be counted. This case is expected to reach the Supreme Court.

title: An Arizona Lawmaker announced she was getting an abortion. Here's what happened next.
description: State Sen. Eva Burch hopes her experiences will convince her colleagues to leave abortion access up doctors- and Arizona voters this fall.

title: Life Without a Government in Haiti
description: Haiti is the middle of a crisis and is without a government as gangs in Port-au-Prince prevent one. But some parts of Haiti have lived without a functioning government for so long they cannot remember what it's like to have one. Our reporter in Haiti takes us to one such village.

title: Best-selling psychologist of Thinking, Fast and Slow, dies at 90
description: One of the founders of behavioral economics, who incorporated human quirks into the study of how people make economic decisions, has died. Daniel Kahneman was 90.

title: Cash-strapped Trump is now selling $60 Bibles, U.S. Constitution included
description: The "God Bless The USA" Bible is inspired by the Lee Greenwood anthem and includes copies of the nation's founding documents. Trump launched it ahead of Easter as his financial woes mount.

title: Here's what to know about dengue, as Puerto Rico declares a public health emergency
description: Most people with dengue will show no signs of infection or experience only mild symptoms, but in rare cases infections can become severe and potentially fatal.

title: Kickoffs will look radically different in the NFL next year. Here's how and why
description: For years, the NFL has tweaked kickoff rules to reduce injuries, resulting in kickoffs that were safer but more boring. The changes aim to re-introduce excitement while keeping injuries low.

title: Baltimore's bridge collapse is expected to disrupt supply chains
description: The Port of Baltimore handles high volumes of auto imports, so while it's at a standstill, some cars and trucks will have to be diverted to other ports, which could raise costs.

title: 1 in 10 Asian Americans live in poverty. Their experiences vary widely, research says
description: Pew Research Center found that poverty rates range greatly among Asian American groups. While 6% of Indian Americans live in poverty, the rate is 19% for Burmese Americans.

title: As theaters scramble to reach new audiences, three get $1 million each
description: The Mellon Foundation announced grants of $1 million to three theaters: Actors Theatre of Louisville, Long Wharf in New Haven and Portland Center Stage.

title: 6 presumed dead in Baltimore bridge collapse; former RNC chair dropped from NBC
description: Recovery efforts are underway for six people presumed dead in the Baltimore bridge collapse. NBC has dropped a former RNC chair as a contributor after backlash from the public and its network stars.

title: Baltimore's Key Bridge was built in the '70s, but has a deep and patriotic history
description: The bridge was built mere yards from where Francis Scott Key watched the British bombardment of Fort McHenry in 1814, inspiring him to write the song that would become the U.S. national anthem.

title: Ukraine's Kharkiv moves classrooms underground so kids survive Russian attacks
description: With Russian troops on the offensive, Ukraine's second-largest city is taking the drastic step of moving classrooms for primary and secondary education underground.

title: In Pennsylvania, she wants to hand out new syringes to save lives. But is it legal?
description: As billions from opioid settlements pour into states, Pennsylvania's efforts against addiction could be hamstrung because clean syringes could be considered illegal drug paraphernalia.

title: What we know and don't know about Baltimore's Key bridge collapse
description: Eight construction workers are thought to have fallen into the bridge at the time of the collision. Six are still unaccounted for and presumed to be dead, authorties said.

title: Why VP Harris is seen as critical to Biden's reelection campaign
description: The vice president has been traveling across the country, giving increasingly higher-profile remarks to key voting groups.

title: Loss of ship's power and stiff current may have led to bridge collision, experts say
description: A momentary loss of propulsion or electricity aboard the massive cargo vessel as it maneuvered in a tight channel in Baltimore may have triggered a cascade of events leading to the bridge collision.

title: People say they're leaving religion due to anti-LGBTQ teachings and sexual abuse
description: People in the U.S. are switching religions and leaving religion altogether in large numbers. A new survey from the Public Religion Research Institute shows a high level of "religious churning."

title: The Baltimore bridge collapse gave conspiracy theorists a chance to boost themselves
description: One researcher says it has become "standard" for any unexpected event "to be run through a filter of conspiracy theories based on the personal brand of the person spreading the theory."

title: Why the mpox outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo is worrying disease docs
description: With a dramatic jump in cases — and a strain of mpox that is deadlier than the virus that went global in 2022 — specialists are scrambling to reign it in.

title: In Lakota Nation, people are asking: Who does a language belong to?
description: Many Lakota people agree: It's imperative to revitalize the Lakota language. But how exactly to do that is a matter of broader debate. Should Lakota be codified and standardized to make learning it easier? Or should the language stay as it always has been, defined by many different ways of writing and speaking? We explore this complex, multi-generational fight that's been unfolding in the Lakota Nation, from Standing Rock to Pine Ridge.

title: Visa, Mastercard settle long-running antitrust suit over swipe fees with merchants
description: Visa and Mastercard announced a major settlement with U.S. merchants, potentially ending years of litigation over the fees charged every time a credit or debit card is used in a store or restaurant.

title: The winless lottery streak ends. Someone wins the $1.12 billion Mega Millions jackpot
description: Until the latest drawing, the 8th largest in U.S. lottery history, no one had won the Mega Millions jackpot since Dec. 8. That amounted to 30 straight drawings without a big winner.

title: Diddy's lawyers say feds used 'military-level force' in home raids
description: A day after Homeland Security Investigations officials descended on Sean Combs' Miami and Los Angeles residences, his lawyers are calling it an "unprecedented ambush."
